Class RosterManager

java.lang.Object
RosterManager
public class RosterManager
extends java.lang.Object
This class reads standard input from the user and executes, processes the commands, and then displays results to user in standard output
Author:
Christian Osma, Liam Smith

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private Roster roster  
    private java.util.Scanner sc  

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    RosterManager()
    Initializes sc to a new Scanner that takes standard input from user and roster to a new Roster object with an initial capacity of 4.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    private Major getMajor​(java.lang.String major)
    Takes String input and returns its equivalent value in the enum Major class.
    private void handleAddStudent​(java.util.StringTokenizer st)
    Adds student to the Roster given the rest of the user input.
    private void handleChangeMajor​(java.util.StringTokenizer st)
    Changes student major given the rest of the command from the user.
    private void handleListStudent​(java.lang.String string)
    Method takes string representation of a school and calls roster method that returns lists of students belonging to that school, then prints it out to Standard Output.
    private void handleRemoveStudent​(java.util.StringTokenizer st)
    Removes student from the Roster unless they are not in the roster.
    private boolean isBeforeCurrent​(Date dob)
    Takes in a student's date of birth and returns true if the student was born before present and false otherwise
    private void loop()
    Creates a loop that continues to take user commands and execute them until the user exits the program.
    void run()
    Starts roster manager and calls the method loop() which takes user input.
    private boolean validDate​(Date date, java.lang.String stringDate)
    Helper method that checks if the date is a valid of date of birth.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • sc

      private java.util.Scanner sc

    • roster

      private Roster roster

  • Constructor Details

    • RosterManager

      public RosterManager()
      Initializes sc to a new Scanner that takes standard input from user and roster to a new Roster object with an initial capacity of 4.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      Starts roster manager and calls the method loop() which takes user input.

    • loop

      private void loop()
      Creates a loop that continues to take user commands and execute them until the user exits the program.

    • handleChangeMajor

      private void handleChangeMajor​(java.util.StringTokenizer st)
      Changes student major given the rest of the command from the user. Prints out error if major is invalid or if the student is not in the roster and success message if major was successfully changed
      Parameters:
      st - : StringTokenizer that contains the rest of the user command

    • handleAddStudent

      private void handleAddStudent​(java.util.StringTokenizer st)
      Adds student to the Roster given the rest of the user input. Returns error if date is invalid, student is less than 16 years old, credits is invalid, major is invalid, or the student is already in the roster.
      Parameters:
      st - : StringTokenizer that contains the rest of user input

    • validDate

      private boolean validDate​(Date date, java.lang.String stringDate)
      Helper method that checks if the date is a valid of date of birth.
      Parameters:
      date - Date object which represents the date to be checked
      stringDate - date inputted by the user, which is used to print error to standard output
      Returns:
      true if the date is a valid date of birth and false otherwise

    • handleRemoveStudent

      private void handleRemoveStudent​(java.util.StringTokenizer st)
      Removes student from the Roster unless they are not in the roster. Prints out error or success message.
      Parameters:
      st - : StringTokenizer that contains the rest of the user input

    • handleListStudent

      private void handleListStudent​(java.lang.String string)
      Method takes string representation of a school and calls roster method that returns lists of students belonging to that school, then prints it out to Standard Output.
      Parameters:
      string - : a string representation of the school

    • getMajor

      private Major getMajor​(java.lang.String major)
      Takes String input and returns its equivalent value in the enum Major class.
      Parameters:
      major - : String representation of the inputed major
      Returns:
      returns object from Major class depending on input

    • isBeforeCurrent

      private boolean isBeforeCurrent​(Date dob)
      Takes in a student's date of birth and returns true if the student was born before present and false otherwise
      Parameters:
      dob - : student's date of birth
      Returns:
      true if student was born before present day
